title: JSON Parser
description: Parse JSON (JavaScript Object Notation), a lightweight data interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write, and easy for machines to parse and generate.

motivation.why: JSON is the de facto standard for data exchange in web APIs, configuration files, and data storage. It's supported by virtually every programming language and is the backbone of modern web services.

inputFormat.description: JSON supports primitive types (null, boolean, number, string), arrays, and objects (key-value maps). Strings use double quotes with escape sequences.
inputFormat.syntax: value = null | true | false | number | string | array | object

examples.description: Invalid: unquoted keys and single quotes

outputFormat.description: The parser returns a JsonValue enum representing the parsed JSON structure with proper type distinctions.

type.description: JsonValue enum with variants: Null, Bool(bool), Number(f64), String(String), Array(Vec<JsonValue>), Object(HashMap<String, JsonValue>)

Object.description: Key-value map where keys are strings and values are JsonValue
